articles.headline: Start-Up Airlines in a Struggle to Survive
articles.snippet: Barriers to success include access to takeoff slots and gates, and restrictions on foreign investments.
articles.abstract: Barriers to success include access to takeoff slots and gates, and restrictions on foreign investments.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the airline industry, the fittest do not always survive. But that has not stopped start-up carriers like Virgin America from trying.

articles.headline: Turning East, Turkey Asserts Economic Power
articles.snippet: Turkey is closer to fulfilling the criteria for adopting the euro than most of the troubled economies already in the euro zone.
articles.abstract: Turkey is closer to fulfilling the criteria for adopting the euro than most of the troubled economies already in the euro zone.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL  For decades, Turkey has been told it was not ready to join the European Union  that it was too backward economically to qualify for membership in the now 27-nation club.

articles.headline: Calls to Update Maritime Laws
articles.snippet: The BP spill has focused attention on outdated maritime laws that make it difficult to win damages for death or injury at sea.
articles.abstract: The BP spill has focused attention on outdated maritime laws that make it difficult to win damages for death or injury at sea.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Washington are fixed on the legal and financial fallout of the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico on BP and firms like Transocean, the operator of the Deepwater Horizon rig that sank in April.

articles.headline: After a Shift, Shares Surge at SanDisk
articles.snippet: The maker of high-speed memory chips changed its focus during a downturn, from retail to direct sales to device makers and sellers, and the company’s shares have soared.
articles.abstract: The maker of high-speed memory chips changed its focus during a downturn, from retail to direct sales to device makers and sellers, and the company’s shares have soared.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILPITAS, Calif.  Eli Harari demands that his drinking water arrive at room temperature. It’s an understandable desire for something moderate from a man who spends so much of his life battling extremes.

articles.headline: Sides Form Over Threat to Saturday Mail Service
articles.snippet: A proposal for five-day service by the post office, which also wants to raise rates, faces hearings on July 12.
articles.abstract: A proposal for five-day service by the post office, which also wants to raise rates, faces hearings on July 12.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As federal regulators consider a proposal to cut most Saturday postal deliveries, the business community is sharply divided about the consequences of switching to five-day service.

articles.headline: Supply Chain for iPhone Highlights Costs in China
articles.snippet: Labor costs, a stronger currency and rising housing prices threaten to raise the cost of making electronics.
articles.abstract: Labor costs, a stronger currency and rising housing prices threaten to raise the cost of making electronics.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENZHEN, China  Last month, while enthusiastic consumers were playing with their new Apple iPhone 4, researchers in Silicon Valley were engaged in something more serious.

articles.headline: Tax-Exempt Funds Aid Settlements in West Bank
articles.snippet: As the United States seeks to end a four-decade Jewish settlement enterprise, the American Treasury helps sustain the settlements through tax breaks on donations to support them.
articles.abstract: As the United States seeks to end a four-decade Jewish settlement enterprise, the American Treasury helps sustain the settlements through tax breaks on donations to support them.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg, Mike McIntire and Ethan Bronner

articles.headline: Haitian Orphans Have Little but One Another
articles.snippet: A makeshift orphanage and improvised family face an uncertain future as an eviction looms.
articles.abstract: A makeshift orphanage and improvised family face an uncertain future as an eviction looms.
articles.lead_paragraph: CROIX-DES-BOUQUETS, Haiti — More than five months after the earthquake that killed her single mother, Daphne Joseph, 14, lost her bearings a second time when she was forced to leave the makeshift orphanage where she had felt at home.
